Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice with part of cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; two faded added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of boar and lion confronted (on left, part of head and foot of boar, to right; on right, paw of lion, to left); dot rosette as filling ornament; below, two narrow bands; on cul, part of double guilloche pattern with red dots.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as coming from a mediocre and big chalice belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice-kraters. Chalices in this group display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 90, p. 255, no. 450, pl. 61)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1546) (phase 2)
